Tasks.Task Description: Use Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to continuously monitor the health and operational status of the Azure Route Server. Investigate any anomalies or potential issues.
Regularly check the stability of BGP sessions between Azure Route Server and connected routers. Monitor for route flaps or unexpected changes in route advertisements.
Analyze route advertisements to ensure they align with expected configurations and do not include unauthorized or incorrect routes.
Conduct failover tests to verify that redundant paths and configurations function correctly in case of primary path failures.
Review and update security policies, including access controls and encryption settings, to ensure the Azure Route Server is secure against potential threats.
Conduct audits of the Azure Route Server configuration to ensure compliance with documented architecture and best practices.
Regularly back up the configuration of Azure Route Server and connected routers. Ensure secure storage of backups for potential restoration.
Keep Azure Route Server documentation up-to-date, including operational procedures, configuration details, and troubleshooting guides.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or Azure Route Server outages. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Evaluate the SLA performance of the connectivity provider for Azure Route Server. Address any issues or deviations from the agreed SLA metrics.
Develop and execute plans for Azure Route Server upgrades or expansions as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Azure Route Server features, best practices, and security measures.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Azure Route Server performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
